page.title: 08MUTHILL, SPECIAL FEATURES
page.content: {Dog's Head Well- }this unusual well beside the Highlandman Park dates from the 18th century when cattle drovers rested there.It is no longer in use. {Sundial} - high on the wall at 48 Drummond St. Workmen used to assemble beneath it at 6a.m. for work at Drummond Castle, and also dispersed from there after their day's work. {Public Hall}-erected originally as a Free Church.After a new church was built (now demolished) it was purchased by the Earl of Ancaster and gifted to the community for use as a public hall. {Recreation Club}- former Episcopal Church School, converted into club after World War 1. {Coronation Park}- public park established after Coronation of Queen Elizabeth in 1953, now managed by Community Council.
